What are my patient rights?

12. Examining and receiving an explanation of the bill regardless of source of payment.
13. Knowing which hospital rules and policies apply to your conduct while a patient.
14. Having all of your rights apply to the person who may have legal responsibility to make decisions regarding medical care on your behalf.
15. Designating visitors of your choosing, if you have decision making capacity, whether or not the visitor is related by blood or marriage.
16. Having your wishes considered for purposes of determining who may visit if you lack decision making capacity.
17. Being free from seclusion and restraints used in behavior management unless clinically necessary.
How do I request medical records?
To request medical records, you need to complete a Release of Information form. This form must be completed, dated, and signed. Specify which parts of your medical records you wish to obtain. Once you have completed your request, you can submit it by mail or in person to the Health Information Management Department, or by faxing the form. If you plan to have someone else pick up your records, make sure your representative has an original, signed authorization letter from you, as well as a photo ID. Please allow up to 10 business days or 14 calendar days for your request to be processed. Records requested for a physician or other provider are sent to the provider at no cost. If you would like to obtain a copy for your records, costs could apply.
